snippet: The state must let same-sex couples marry and file joint income tax returns, and put both parents’ names on their children’s birth certificates, a Federal District Court judge ruled.
abstract: Federal District Judge Martin Feldman rules that Louisiana must recognize same-sex marriages, throwing out his earlier ruling; decision is largely procedural in wake of Supreme Court decision on matter.
lead_paragraph: The state must let same-sex couples marry and file joint income tax returns, and put both parents’ names on their children’s birth certificates, a Federal District Court judge ruled.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
